member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Extensions.TruckDistanceMatrixGenerator.Calculate(BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Calculates a distance matrix based on truck routing attributes.
member.param: The distance matrix request to base the request on.
A callback function in which the estimated remaining time in seconds is sent.
member.returns: A response which contains the truck routing based distance matrix.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Extensions.TruckDistanceMatrixGenerator.CalculateCell(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest)
member.summary: Calculates a truck ruting based matrix cell.
member.param: The index of the origin.
The index of the destination.
The time interval index.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.ManeuverType

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.ManeuverTypeEnum
member.summary: An enumeration version of the ManeuverType.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.StartPathIndices
member.summary: This field specifies the index values for specific route path points that are returned in the response when a route path is returned. This and the EndPathIndices correspond to a maneuver route path.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.EndPathIndices
member.summary: This field specifies the index values for specific route path points that are returned in the response when a route path is returned. This and the StartPathIndices correspond to a maneuver route path.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.RoadType
member.summary: The type of road.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.LocationCodes
member.summary: A traffic location code. Each location code provides traffic incident information for pre-defined road segments. There may be multiple codes for each Detail collection in the response. A subscription is typically required to be able to interpret these codes for a geographical area or country.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.Names
member.summary: A street, highway or intersection where the maneuver occurs. If the maneuver is complex, there may be more than one name field in the details collection. The name field may also have no value. This can occur if the name is not known or if a street, highway or intersection does not have a name. This value is only supported for the transit travel mode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.Mode
member.summary: Describes the mode of transportation used between a pair of indexes. This can differ depending whether the route requires walking, driving, or transit. Not all regions or cultures support all values of this field.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Detail.RoadShieldRequestParameters
member.summary: Information on the road shield.

member.summary: The index of the destination in the provided destinations array used to calculate this cell.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.TravelDistance
member.summary: The physical distance covered to complete a route between the origin and destination. When travel mode is set to transit or a path between the origin and destination can't be calculated, this value is set to -1.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.TravelDuration
member.summary: The time that it takes, in minutes, to travel a corresponding TravelDistance. If a path a path between the origin and destination can't be calculated, this value will be a negative number.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.TotalWalkDuration
member.summary: The portion of the total route duration which requires walking. This may occur when the travel mode is set to transit.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.DepartureTime
member.summary: The departure time in which this cell was calculated for. Only returned when a startTime is specified. When an endTime is specified in the request several cells will be returned for the same origin and destination pairs, each having a different departure time for each time interval in the generated histogram request. This string is in ISO 8601 date format.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.DepartureTimeUtc
member.summary: The departure time in which this cell was calculated for. Only returned when a startTime is specified. When an endTime is specified in the request several cells will be returned for the same origin and destination pairs, each having a different departure time for each time interval in the generated histogram request.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixCell.HasError
member.summary: A boolean indicating if an error occurred when calculating this cell.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationData
member.summary: An Elevation service response object.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationData.Elevations
member.summary: A list of elevation values in meters.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationData.ZoomLevel
member.summary:
The zoom level used to compute the elevation values. Zoom level values are from 1 to 21. A lower value typically means less accurate results because the resolution of the elevation data is less. At lower resolutions, interpolated elevation values use data points that are further apart.
The zoom level used depends on the amount of elevation data available in a region and can be lowered when the specified path covers a long distance.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Generalization
member.summary: Generalization information for a route path.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Generalization.PathIndices
member.summary: Specifies a subset of points from the complete set of route path points (line collection) to include in the RoutePathGeneralization. The list of point values in the route path line collection are given indices starting with 0. For example, an index value of 0 indicates that the first point in the Line collection is included in this RoutePathGeneralization.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Generalization.LatLongTolerance
member.summary: The tolerance specified in the route request that is associated with the RoutePathGeneralization.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse
member.summary: This response specifies: - Whether this is a politically disputed area, such as an area claimed by more than one country. - Whether services are available in the user’s region. - A list of available geospatial services including endpoints and language support for each service.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.IsDisputedArea
member.summary: Specifies if this area in the request is claimed by more than one country.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.IsSupported
member.summary: Specifies if Geospatial Platform services are available in the country or region. Microsoft does not support services in embargoed areas.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.UserRegion
member.summary: The country or region that was used to determine service support. If you specified a User Location in the request that is in a non-disputed country or region, this country or region is returned in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.Services
member.summary: Information for each geospatial service that is available in the country or region and language specified in the request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService
member.summary: Information for a geospatial service that is available in the country or region and language specified in the request.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.Endpoint
member.summary: The URL service endpoint to use in this region. Note that to use the service, you must typically add parameters specific to the service. These parameters are not described in this documentation.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.FallbackLanguage
member.summary: Set to true if the service supports the language in the request for the region. If the language is supported, then the service endpoint will return responses using this language. If it is not supported, then the service will use the fallback language.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.LanguageSupported
member.summary: Specifies the secondary or fallback language in this region or country. If the requested language is not supported and a fallback language is not available, United States English (en-us) is used.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.ServiceName
member.summary: An abbreviated name for the service.

member.summary: The postal address for the location.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.AddressLine
member.summary: The official street line of an address relative to the area, as specified by the Locality, or PostalCode, properties. Typical use of this element would be to provide a street address or any official address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.AdminDistrict
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address. This element is typically treated as the first order administrative subdivision, but in some cases it is the second, third, or fourth order subdivision in a country, dependency, or region.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.AdminDistrict2
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address. This element is used when there is another level of subdivision information for a location, such as the county.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.CountryRegion
member.summary: A string specifying the country or region name of an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.Locality
member.summary: A string specifying the populated place for the address. This typically refers to a city, but may refer to a suburb or a neighborhood in certain countries.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.PostalCode
member.summary: A string specifying the post code, postal code, or ZIP Code of an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.CountryRegionIso2
member.summary: A string specifying the two-letter ISO country code. You must specify include=ciso2 in your request to return this ISO country code.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.FormattedAddress
member.summary: A string specifying the complete address. This address may not include the country or region.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.Neighborhood
member.summary: A string specifying the neighborhood for an address. You must specify includeNeighborhood=1 in your request to return the neighborhood.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Address.Landmark
member.summary: A string specifying the name of the landmark when there is a landmark associated with an address.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem
member.summary: Information that defines a step in the route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.ChildItineraryItems
member.summary: A collection of ItineraryItems that divides an itinerary item into smaller steps. An itinerary item can have only one set of ChildItineraryItems.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.CompassDirection
member.summary: The direction of travel associated with a maneuver on a route, such as south or southwest. This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Details
member.summary: Information about one of the maneuvers that is part of the itinerary item. An ItineraryItem can contain more than one Detail collection.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Exit
member.summary: The name or number of the exit associated with this itinerary step.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Hints
member.summary: Additional information that may be helpful in following a route. In addition to the hint text, this element has an attribute hintType that specifies what the hint refers to, such as “NextIntersection.” Hint is an optional element and a route step can contain more than one hint.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.IconType
member.summary: The type of icon to display. Possible values include: None, Airline, Auto, Bus, Ferry, Train, Walk, Other

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Instruction
member.summary: A description of a maneuver in a set of directions.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.ManeuverPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of a point on the Earth where a maneuver is required, such as a left turn. A ManeuverPoint contains Latitude and Longitude elements. This value is not supported for ItineraryItems that are part of a ChildItineraryItems collection.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.SideOfStreet
member.summary: The side of the street where the destination is found based on the arrival direction. This field applies to the last itinerary item only. Possible values include: Left, Right, Unknown

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Signs
member.summary: Signage text for the route. There may be more than one sign value for an itinerary item.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Time
member.summary: The arrival or departure time for the transit step.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TimeUtc
member.summary: The arrival or departure time for the transit step.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TollZone
member.summary: The name or number of the toll zone.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TowardsRoadName
member.summary: The name of the street that the route goes towards in the first itinerary item.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TransitLine
member.summary: Information about the transit line associated with the itinerary item.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TransitStopId
member.summary: The ID assigned to the transit stop by the transit agency.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TransitTerminus
member.summary: The end destination for the transit line in the direction you are traveling.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TravelDistance
member.summary: The physical distance covered by this route step. This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TravelDuration
member.summary: The time that it takes, in seconds, to travel a corresponding TravelDistance.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.TravelMode
member.summary: The mode of travel for a specific step in the route. This value is not supported for ItineraryItems that are part of a ChildItineraryItems collection.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ItineraryItem.Warnings
member.summary: Information about a condition that may affect a specific step in the route. Warning is an optional element and a route step can contain more than one warning. Warnings can include traffic incident information such as congestion, accident and blocked road reports. Warning elements are further defined by two attributes: Severity and WarningType. Severity can have the following values: Low Impact, Minor, Moderate, or Serious.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.Type
member.summary: The type information of the point.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.Coordinates
member.summary: The coordinate information of the point [Latitude,Longitude].

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.CalculationMethod
member.summary: The method that was used to compute the geocode point. Can be one of the following values: Interpolation: The geocode point was matched to a point on a road using interpolation. InterpolationOffset: The geocode point was matched to a point on a road using interpolation with an additional offset to shift the point to the side of the street. Parcel: The geocode point was matched to the center of a parcel. Rooftop: The geocode point was matched to the rooftop of a building.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.UsageTypes
member.summary: The best use for the geocode point. Can be Display or Route. Each geocode point is defined as a Route point, a Display point or both. Use Route points if you are creating a route to the location.Use Display points if you are showing the location on a map. For example, if the location is a park, a Route point may specify an entrance to the park where you can enter with a car, and a Display point may be a point that specifies the center of the park.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.GetCoordinate
member.summary: Converts the coordinate information in the point into a Coordinate object.
member.returns: Coordinate object representing the coordinate information in the point.

member.summary: Information about a section of a route between two waypoints.

member.summary: The physical distance covered by a route leg.

member.summary: The time that it takes, in seconds, to travel a corresponding TravelDistance.

member.summary: The cost of the journey. Provided for transit routes in some countries.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.Description
member.summary: A short description of the route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.ActualStart
member.summary: The Point (latitude and longitude) that was used as the actual starting location for the route leg. In most cases, the ActualStart is the same as the requested waypoint. However, if a waypoint is not close to a road, the Routes API chooses a location on the nearest road as the starting point of the route. This ActualStart element contains the latitude and longitude of this new location.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.ActualEnd
member.summary: The Point (latitude and longitude) that was used as the actual ending location for the route leg. In most cases, the ActualEnd is the same as the requested waypoint. However, if a waypoint is not close to a road, the Routes API chooses a location on the nearest road as the ending point of the route. This ActualEnd element contains the latitude and longitude of this new location.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.StartLocation
member.summary: Information about the location of the starting waypoint for a route. A StartLocation is provided only when the waypoint is specified as a landmark or an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.EndLocation
member.summary: Information about the location of the endinpoint for a route. An EndLocation is provided only when the waypoint is specified as a landmark or an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.ItineraryItems
member.summary: Information that defines a step in the route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.RouteSubLegs
member.summary: Information about a segments of the route leg defined by the route leg waypoints and any intermediate via-waypoints. For example, if the route leg has two via-waypoints in addition to start and end waypoints, there would be three (3) route sub-legs.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.StartTime
member.summary: Used for transit route responses. Shows the starting time for the starting point of the route. This tells you when to be at the starting waypoint depending on what you select as the dateTime and the timeType.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.StartTimeUtc
member.summary: Used for transit route responses. Shows the starting time for the starting point of the route. This tells you when to be at the starting waypoint depending on what you select as the dateTime and the timeType.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.EndTime
member.summary: Used for transit route responses. Shows the time of arrival when specific route is taken. This tells you when to be at the ending waypoint depending on what you select as the dateTime and the timeType parameters

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteLeg.EndTimeUtc
member.summary: Used for transit route responses. Shows the time of arrival when specific route is taken. This tells you when to be at the ending waypoint depending on what you select as the dateTime and the timeType parameters

member.summary: The difference between sea level models for a set of locations.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SeaLevelData.ZoomLevel
member.summary:
The zoom level used to compute the elevation values. Zoom level values are from 1 to 21. A lower value typically means less accurate results because the resolution of the elevation data is less. At lower resolutions, interpolated elevation values use data points that are further apart.
The zoom level used depends on the amount of elevation data available in a region and can be lowered when the specified path covers a long distance.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions
member.summary: A class that defines the options that can to use when calculating a route.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.#ctor
member.summary: A class that defines the options that can to use when calculating a route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Avoid
member.summary: Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when a route is created for the driving travel mode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DistanceBeforeFirstTurn
member.summary: Specifies the distance before the first turn is allowed in the route. This option only applies to the driving travel mode. An integer distance specified in meters. Use this parameter to make sure that the moving vehicle has enough distance to make the first turn.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Heading
member.summary: Specifies the initial heading for the route. An integer value between 0 and 359 that represents degrees from north where north is 0 degrees and the heading is specified clockwise from north.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Optimize
member.summary: Specifies what parameters to use to optimize the route. Default: Time

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.TravelMode
member.summary: The mode of travel for the route. Default: Driving

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DateTime
member.summary: The dateTime parameter identifies the desired time to be used when calculating a route. This is supported by driving and transit routes. When calculating driving routes the route optimization type should be TimeWithTraffic. The route time will be used as the departure time. When calculating transit routes timeType can be specified.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.TimeType
member.summary: Specifies how to interpret the date and transit time value that is specified by the dateTime parameter.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies to include or exclude parts of the routes response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DistanceUnits
member.summary: The units to use for distance.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Tolerances
member.summary: Specifies a series of tolerance values. Each value produces a subset of points that approximates the route that is described by the full set of points. This parameter is only valid when the routePathOutput parameter is set to Points. You can specify a maximum of seven (7) tolerance values.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.MaxSolutions
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of transit or driving routes to return. An interger between 1 and 3. This parameter is available for the Driving and Transit travel modes for routes between two waypoints. This parameter does not support routes with more than two waypoints. For driving routes, you must not set the avoid and distanceBeforeFirstTurn parameters. The maxSolutions parameter is supported for routes in the United States, Canada, Mexico, United Kingdom, Australia, and India.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.VehicleSpec
member.summary: Truck routing specific vehicle attribute.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest
member.summary: A request that calculates a distance matrix between origins and destinations.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.MaxCoordinatePairs
member.summary: The maximum number of coordinate pairs that can be in a standar distance matrix request.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.MaxAsyncCoordinatePairsHistogram
member.summary: The maximum number of coordinate pairs that can be in an Async request for a distance matrix histogram.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.MaxTimeSpanHours
member.summary: The maximum number of hours between the start and end time when calculating a distance matrix histogram.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.#ctor
member.summary: A request that calculates a distance matrix between origins and destinations.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.Origins
member.summary: Required. List of origins described as coordinate pairs with latitudes and longitudes.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.Destinations
member.summary: List of destinations described as coordinate pairs with latitudes and longitudes.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.TravelMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode of transportation to use when calculating the distance matrix. Can be one of the following values: driving [default], walking, transit.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.StartTime
member.summary: Optional for Driving. Specifies the start or departure time of the matrix to calculate and uses traffic data in calculations. This option is only supported when the mode is set to driving.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceMatrixRequest.EndTime
member.summary: Optional for Driving. If specified, a matrix based on traffic data with contain a histogram of travel times and distances for the specified resolution (default is 15 minutes) between the start and end times. A start time must be specified for the request to be valid. This option is only supported when the mode is set to driving.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression
member.summary:
This compression algorithm encodes/decodes a collections of coordinates into a string. This algorithm is used for generating a compressed collection of coordinates for use with the Bing Maps REST Elevation Service. This algorithm is also used for decoding the compressed coordinates returned by the GeoData API.
These algorithms come from the following documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj158958.aspx http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn306801.aspx

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression.Encode(System.Collections.Generic.List{BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate})
member.summary: Compresses a list of coordinates into a string. Based on: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj158958.aspx
member.param: Collection of coordinates to compress.
member.returns: A compressed string representing a collection coordinates.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression.TryDecode(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate}@)
member.summary: Decodes a collection of coordinates from a compressed string. Based on: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn306801.aspx
member.param: Compressed string to decode
Collection of decoded coordinates.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the algorithm was able to decode the compressed coordinates or not.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest
member.summary: A request that calculates routes between waypoints.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.waypointsHash
member.summary: Hash values used to quickly check if any thing needed for waypoint optimization has changed since the last travelling salesmen calculation.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.Waypoints
member.summary: Specifies two or more locations that define the route and that are in sequential order. A route is defined by a set of waypoints and viaWaypoints (intermediate locations that the route must pass through). You can have a maximum of 10 viaWaypoints between each set of waypoints. The start and end points of the route cannot be viaWaypoints.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.RouteOptions
member.summary: Options to use when calculate route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.BatchSize
member.summary: The maximium number of waypoints that can be in a single request. If the batchSize is smaller than the number of waypoints, when the request is executed, it will break the request up into multiple requests. Must by between 2 and 25. Default: 25.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.WaypointOptimization
member.summary: Specifies if the waypoint order should be optimized using a travelling salesmen algorithm which metric to optimize on. If less than 10 waypoints, brute force is used, for more than 10 waypoints, a genetic algorithm is used. Ignores IsViaPoint on waypoints and makes them waypoints. Default: false Warning: If travel time or travel distance is used, a standard Bing Maps key will need to be required, not a session key, as the distance matrix API will be used to process the waypoints. This can generate a lot of billable transactions.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.Execute
member.summary: Executes the request. If there are more waypoints than the batchSize value (default 25), only a MaxSolutions is set to 1, and Tolerances is set to null.
member.returns: A response containing the requested data.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.Execute(System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Executes the request. If there are more waypoints than the batchSize value (default 25), only a MaxSolutions is set to 1, and Tolerances is set to null.
member.param: A callback function in which the estimated remaining time in seconds is sent.
member.returns: A response containing the requested data.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL to perform a query for route directions. This method will only generate a URL that includes the first batchSize waypoints in the request.
member.returns: A request URL to perform a query for route directions.
